To correctly classify desired objects Facebooks Detectron2 did an amazing job to make programmers implement complicated computer vision algorithms easily. md a default predictor class to make predictions on an image using a trained model a config of cfg in Detectron2 is a series of instructions for building a model a class to help visualize Detectron2 predictions on an image stores information about the model such as what the training test data is what the class names are Get absolute path of JSON label file Check to see if json_file exists Convert bbox_mode to Enum of BoxMode. script: load_json_labels detectron2.utils.visualizer pyplot pyplot as plt detectron2.structures DatasetCatalog COCOEvaluator detectron2.config detectron2.evaluation numpy MetadataCatalog # stores information about the model such get_cfg detectron2 get_cfg # a config of "cfg" in Detectron2 is a series of instructions for building a model inference_on_dataset model_zoo # a series of pre-trained Detectron2 models: https://github.com/facebookresearch/detectron2/blob/master/MODEL_ZOO.md MetadataCatalog # stores information about the model such as what the training/test data is detectron2.data Visualizer # a class to help visualize Detectron2 predictions on an image build_detection_test_loader BoxMode matplotlib detectron2.engine DefaultTrainer change_brightness DefaultPredictor # a default predictor class to make predictions on an image using a trained model what the class names are MetadataCatalog
